description: A medical student was allegedly gang-raped in West Bengal's Paschim Bardhaman district, sparking a political row. The BJP accused the state government of appeasement policies leading to a "nightmare for women's safety." West Bengal minister Shashi Panja urged the BJP not to politicize the crime and expressed faith in the ongoing investigation.

2nd Test: Gill’s 129 powers India; Jadeja spins Windies into trouble
description: India's spinners have taken control of the second Test against the West Indies. Captain Shubman Gill scored an impressive century, setting a strong foundation. The West Indies are trailing significantly after losing four wickets. Ravindra Jadeja claimed three wickets, putting India in a commanding position to win the series. The Indian team displayed excellent batting and bowling throughout the day.

Clashes rock Pakistan: Police fire on Gaza protesters - what we know so far
description: Hardline Islamist group Tehreek-i-Labbaik Pakistan (TLP) protests turned violent across Pakistan, resulting in at least 11 deaths and dozens injured. Demonstrators marched towards Islamabad in solidarity with Palestinians, clashing with police who used tear gas and barricades. The TLP, known for disruptive protests, faced government warnings against further marches.

description: Thousands of displaced Palestinians returned to Gaza's shattered north as a US-brokered ceasefire took effect, with Israeli troops beginning to withdraw. Families navigated rubble to reach ruined homes, marking a bittersweet return amid a new peace plan involving troop withdrawal and hostage swaps.

Amitabh Bachchan's secrets to staying healthy at 83: Sleep, cleandiet&more
description: Amitabh Bachchan, at 83, continues to inspire with his disciplined lifestyle. His routine emphasizes daily movement, including pranayama and stretches, alongside a clean, plant-based diet rich in Ayurvedic ingredients. Prioritizing eight to nine hours of sleep and maintaining an unwavering mindset are key to his robust health and longevity, offering valuable lessons for all.

description: The India Skills Report 2025 reveals rising employability among men, reaching 53.46% in 2025. Male professionals prefer working in Gujarat, Andhra Pradesh, Kerala, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, Delhi, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Karnataka, and Haryana. These states offer career growth, infrastructure, and supportive ecosystems. Employers can use this insight for recruitment, while men can align career choices with high-opportunity regions.

'China using these gadgets to spy on Americans', says FCC; issues security notice
description: The FCC has issued a national security notice, warning that Chinese electronics pose a surveillance and security threat to Americans. Millions of prohibited product listings, including security cameras and smartwatches from companies like Huawei and Hikvision, have been removed from US retail platforms. This action is part of Washington's ongoing crackdown on Chinese technology firms due to national security concerns.

Jaz Elle’s one-word reply melts hearts on Agassi’s iconic style
description: Tennis icon Andre Agassi, fresh off leading Team World to victory at the 2025 Laver Cup, delighted fans with a throwback post of his iconic 80s and 90s fashion. His daughter, Jaz Elle Agassi, praised his "Majestic" style. Agassi also shared his competitive spirit as captain, calling the win a "special week."

title: NMC data shows India added just 21 doctors in a year when 80k graduated
description: India's doctor count appears stagnant, with the National Medical Commission (NMC) data showing minimal growth despite thousands graduating annually. Significant discrepancies exist between NMC figures and state medical council registrations, raising concerns about accurate healthcare planning and potentially misleading Parliament.

title: Haryana IPS 'suicide': ADG’s wife accuses cops of diluting charges; DGP, SP 'not named in FIR'
description: Wife of deceased IPS officer Y Puran Kumar, Haryana IAS officer Amneet Kumar, has flagged discrepancies in the FIR registered following his suicide. She insists accused individuals, including senior police officials, are not clearly named and alleges dilution of SC/ST Act charges. Kumar also seeks copies of her husband's final note for verification.

title: Eight Indians, 10 firms face US sanctions over Iran oil link
description: America has sanctioned eight Indian individuals and ten companies. These actions are due to their involvement in trading Iranian oil. The US state department and treasury targeted numerous entities globally. Several Indian firms are accused of importing Iranian-origin petrochemicals and LPG. These shipments were destined for China and Pakistan. The sanctions highlight ongoing efforts to curb Iran's oil trade.

title: 'Indians' success in US no conspiracy': Zoho's Sridhar Vembu
description: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu explains why Indian professionals dominate American technology leadership, attributing it to unintended consequences of the H-1B visa and green card system. The lengthy immigration process made job switching risky, creating committed long-term employees who naturally earned promotions. Vembu emphasises R&D success requires time-intensive commitment, not just funding. His comments come amid controversy over Trump's proposed $100,000 H-1B fee.

title: Microsoft engineer quits after 13 years; sends resignation email to employees
description: A senior Microsoft engineer has resigned protesting the company's cloud contracts with the Israeli military. Scott Sutfin-Glowski cited enabling potential atrocities as his reason for leaving. This follows months of internal dissent and employee firings over Gaza-related demonstrations. Microsoft previously stopped some services to an Israeli intelligence unit after a report. However, many contracts remain active, and employee protests continue. Activists demand a complete cut of ties with Israel.

title: Draisaitl’s 400th goal cheered by wife despite Oilers loss to Flames
description: Edmonton Oilers began their 2025 season with a tough 4-3 shootout loss to the Calgary Flames. However, the night was a personal triumph for Leon Draisaitl, who netted his 400th NHL goal in front of a jubilant home crowd. Despite the team's opening-night setback, Draisaitl's milestone cements his status as a league standout.
